multiple-choice.question: Carleton's Computer Science program has $f$ female students and $m$ male students, where $f \geq 1$ and $f + m \geq 8$. The Carleton Computer Science Society has a Board of Directors consisting of a President, five Vice-Presidents, and two Cider-Presidents (whose task is to buy cider for the President). All members of the Board of Directors are Computer Science students. The President is female, cannot be Vice-President, and cannot be Cider-President. A Vice-President cannot be Cider-President. In how many ways can a Board of Directors be chosen?
